page.title: 01Gazetteer Page
page.content: This Domesday Block comprises part of each of Greater London Boroughs of Merton and Croydon. Its Northern boundary at Streatham Common meets the outer southerly limits of Inner London. The Block is quite a built-up, suburban area, though sprinkled fairly liberally with open common land and parks. The houses in which people live vary from estates of densely-packed three-storied flats to spacious Victorian dwellings that would have housed families and many servants at the turn of the Twentieth Century. The area has a rich historical past - with recorded information on certain features dating back to the 13th Century. There is a rich diversity of ethnic background amongst the block's population.
